message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CL, cs.RO. 

The paper proposes a recurrent model for semantic instance segmentation, which is a task related to computer vision (CV). Therefore, cs.CV is the most likely sub-category. The model is trainable end-to-end, which involves learning from data, and the paper discusses the activations learned in the encoder part of the network, which suggests that machine learning (ML) techniques are used. Hence, cs.LG (Machine Learning) is also likely. The paper also mentions that the proposed system is conceptually simpler than current methods relying on object proposals, which implies that the work involves some level of algorithmic development, making cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) a possible sub-category. The paper deals with semantic segmentation, which involves understanding natural language, and the model generates class probabilities, which suggests that the work involves some level of natural language processing (NLP), making cs.CL (Computation and Language) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper achieves competitive results on three different instance segmentation benchmarks, which suggests that the work involves some level of robotics (RO), making cs.RO a possible sub-category.
